metadata.title: Imagen normal-rara y su efecto en el recuerdo
metadata.description:
Resumen / Abstract

En este estudio, los autores investigaron cómo la combinación de imágenes normales y raras afecta al recuerdo en tareas de memoria. Se diseñaron cinco condiciones experimentales: normal-normal, normal-rara, rara-normal, rara-rara y sin imagen. Los resultados mostraron que las combinaciones que incluían imágenes raras mejoraban significativamente el recuerdo en comparación con las combinaciones de imágenes normales o sin imágenes. Estos hallazgos sugieren que la rareza de las imágenes puede ser un factor determinante en la mejora de la memoria.

creators.name: Pérez-Fabello, María José
creators.affiliation: University of Vigo, Faculty of Fine Arts

references: Paivio, A. (1971). Imagery and Verbal Processes. New York: Holt, Rinehart & Winston.
Nelson, D. L., Reed, V. S., & Walling, J. R. (1976). Pictorial superiority effect. Journal of Experimental Psychology: Human Learning and Memory, 2(5), 523–528.

data.title: Imagen normal-rara y su efecto en el recuerdo

metadata.title: Driver Drowsiness Recognition System Using Raspberry Pi
metadata.description: This paper introduces a Driver Drowsiness Recognition System to enhance road safety by continuously monitoring the alertness of drivers. The system uses the Raspberry Pi 4B as the main controller and combines image processing with fatigue detection algorithms. A switch-based system monitors seatbelt use, while a camera conducts continuous monitoring prior to and during driving. The system has several levels of safety built into it, such as detection of alcohol consumption, seatbelt checks, and real-time observation of drowsiness and yawning through computer vision methods. Facial features are examined to identify fatigue signs, and a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) model scans eye and face conditions to detect drowsiness. When fatigue indicators are sensed, warnings are presented by a buzzer and vibration motor, and repeated warnings will ultimately cause an imitation vehicle shut down. The system proposed herein provides a intelligent, responsive, and efficient mechanism for preventing fatigue-induced accidents.
keywords: Driver Drowsiness Recognition, Rasp- berry Pi 4B, Real-time Alerts, Road Safety, Driver Safety Systems
references: 1.	Singh, R., & Sharma, A. (n.d.). Eye-blink based driver drowsiness detection system. International Journal of Computer Applications, 169(9), 1–5.
2.	Patil, S., Rane, M., & Kulkarni, A. (2019). Real-time driver drowsiness detection using facial features. International Research Journal of Engineering and Technology (IRJET), 6(3), 5295–5299.

3.	Raut, P., & Kshirsagar, P. (2017). Smart car system with alcohol detection, seatbelt monitoring, and accident prevention. International Journal of Advanced Research in Computer and Communication Engineering, 6(5), 360–364.
4.	Kale, M. P., Deshmukh, A., & Joshi, S. (2021). Raspberry Pi based driver drowsiness detection system. International Journal of Science and Research (IJSR), 10(6), 992–995.
5.	Naik, P., & Gaikwad, R. (2021). Driver fatigue detection using OpenCV. International Journal of Innovative Research in Computer and Communication Engineering (IJIRCCE), 9(7), 6372–6376.

data.title: Driver Drowsiness Recognition System Using Raspberry Pi

metadata.title: Hábitos alimentarios e imagen corporal en estudiantes universitarios sin trastornos alimentarios
metadata.description:
Resumen / Abstract

Este estudio transversal tuvo como objetivo determinar la frecuencia de actitudes y conductas autoinformadas asociadas con los trastornos de la conducta alimentaria (TCA) en estudiantes universitarios sin diagnóstico clínico. Se evaluaron variables como la insatisfacción corporal, la preocupación por el peso y los hábitos alimentarios, encontrando una prevalencia significativa de comportamientos de riesgo, especialmente entre las mujeres. Los resultados subrayan la necesidad de intervenciones preventivas en el ámbito universitario para abordar estos factores de riesgo.
references: Garner, D. M., Olmstead, M. P., & Polivy, J. (1983). Development and validation of a multidimensional Eating Disorder Inventory for anorexia nervosa and bulimia nervosa. International Journal of Eating Disorders, 2(2), 15–34.

Toro, J., Salamero, M., & Martínez, E. (1994). Prevalencia de los trastornos de la conducta alimentaria en una población escolar española. Actas Luso-Españolas de Neurología, Psiquiatría y Ciencias Afines, 22(4), 172–178.

data.title: Hábitos alimentarios e imagen corporal en estudiantes universitarios sin trastornos alimentarios

metadata.title: The Influence of Work-Family Conflict on Subjective Well-Being with Perceived Supervisor Support as a Moderating Variable Among Nurses in Private Hospitals in South Lampung
metadata.description: Nursing is a profession with high job demands and irregular working hours, which often lead to conflicts between work and family responsibilities. This condition can trigger Work-Family Conflict (WFC), which negatively affects nurses' subjective well-being. Perceived Supervisor Support (PSS) is considered an important factor in mitigating the negative effects of WFC. This study aims to examine the influence of work-family conflict on subjective well-being and to investigate the moderating role of perceived supervisor support. This research employed a quantitative approach using a questionnaire method. A total of 132 nurses from private hospitals in South Lampung Regency were selected through simple random sampling. The instruments used in this study were the work-family conflict scale, subjective well-being scale, and perceived supervisor support scale. Data were analyzed using Moderated Regression Analysis (MRA) with the assistance of SPSS software. The results showed that work-family conflict had a significant negative effect on nurses’ subjective well-being. Furthermore, perceived supervisor support was proven to moderate the relationship between work-family conflict and subjective well-being. High levels of supervisor support were found to weaken the negative impact of work-family conflict on nurses’ well-being. In conclusion, work-family conflict can reduce the subjective well-being of nurses; however, this effect can be minimized through strong perceived supervisor support. These findings highlight the crucial role of supervisors in creating a supportive work environment to maintain the psychological well-being of nursing staff.

metadata.title: Los trastornos de la conducta alimentaria en estudiantes universitarios españoles
metadata.description:
Resumen / Abstract

Este estudio examina la prevalencia y características de los trastornos de la conducta alimentaria (TCA) en una muestra de estudiantes universitarios españoles, con el objetivo de identificar factores de riesgo asociados al contexto académico y sociocultural. Se aplicaron instrumentos psicométricos validados a una muestra representativa, analizando variables como el género, la autoimagen corporal, la preocupación por el peso y los hábitos alimentarios. Los resultados evidencian una mayor vulnerabilidad en mujeres jóvenes, así como una correlación significativa entre insatisfacción corporal y conductas alimentarias disfuncionales. Estos hallazgos subrayan la necesidad de intervenciones preventivas en el ámbito universitario y la promoción de hábitos saludables desde una perspectiva psicoeducativa.
references: Garner, D. M., Olmstead, M. P., & Polivy, J. (1983). Development and validation of a multidimensional Eating Disorder Inventory for anorexia nervosa and bulimia nervosa. International Journal of Eating Disorders, 2(2), 15–34.
Raich, R. M. (1998). Anorexia y bulimia: Trastornos alimentarios. Madrid: Pirámide.

data.title: Los trastornos de la conducta alimentaria en estudiantes universitarios españoles

metadata.title: VLSI Methodology for Implementation of Iris Recognition Based on Singular Value Decomposition for Feature Extraction
metadata.description: In an Iris recognition System Feature extraction plays a very important role were the only useful dominant information from an eye images are extracted. The SVD algorithm is most focused in this paper were the SVD implemented in both Matlab and FPGA along with the Comparison results. The singular value decomposition is dimensionality reduction algorithm were Jacobi transform is used for parallel and fast computation; paper also focuses on the area and timing analysis. Jacobi algorithm for SVD calculation  is used as it contains a large degree of parallelism. Architecture of SVD core which is implemented consists of 6 sub blocks and all are designed in FPGA were the 77% of overall area is utilized by 40x40 iris template image on target device in 211μsec time.
keywords: Jacobi method,SVD core,Timing and Area analysis
references: 1.	Ignacio Bravo*, Pedro Jimnez, Manuel Mazo, Jos Luis Lzaro, Alfred Gardel "Implementation Of Jacobi Method To Solve The Eigenvalue And Eigenvector Problem",2006.
2.	Brent. R.P and Luk, F.T. "An Efficient Jacobi-like Algorithm for Parallel Eigenvalue Computation", IEEE transactions on computers, vol. 42,no. 9, September 1993.
3.	B.G. Patil, "Human iris pattern recognition using phase components of image", IEEE Conference on Industrial and Information System (ICIIS),DOI:10.1109/ICIINFS.2009.5429900,PP:10-14.
4.	Patil. Ashwini.B, Dr.Mrs.V.Jayashree,, "Segmentation Using Daugman"s Algorithm", International Journal of Latest Transaction in Engineering and Technology, paper_id: IJLTET-2018-2404.
5.	[Online].Available:http://www.cbsr.ia.ac.cn/IrisDatabase/irisdatabase.php.

6.	Lee Aing, Toshiaki Kondo, "Eye State Recognition Using The Hamming Distances Of Eye Image Intensities", IEEE 8th International Conference Of Information and Communication Technology For Embedded System(IC-ICTES), DOI:10.1109/ICTEmSys.2017.7958767, pp:1-5.
7.	B.G.Patil, Nikhil Mane, "Iris feature Extraction and Classification in FPGA", International Journal of Electrical and Computer Engineering (IJECE) VOL.2.April 2012, pp.214-222.

journal.title: Journal of VLSI Design and its Advancement

data.title: VLSI Methodology for Implementation of Iris Recognition Based on Singular Value Decomposition for Feature Extraction

metadata.title: Principles of implementing innovative equipment at a restaurant business enterprise
metadata.description:
The subject of the study is the principles of implementing innovative equipment at a restaurant
business enterprise.
The purpose of the study is to determine the most effective principles of implementing innovative
equipment at a restaurant business enterprise.
Research methods. The article uses the dialectical method of scientific knowledge, the method of
analysis and synthesis, the comparative method, and the method of data generalization.
Results of the work. The article identifies the principles of implementing innovative equipment at
a restaurant business enterprise. The most effective principles of implementing innovative equipment
at a restaurant business enterprise are identified.
Conclusions. The implementation of innovative equipment in the restaurant business is an important
factor in increasing efficiency, competitiveness, and quality of services. Successful integration requires adherence to a number of principles. First of all, a strategic approach is needed, which involves analyzing
the needs of the enterprise, the market, and technological capabilities. The equipment must meet the
development strategy and business goals. Economic feasibility is important. The cost of equipment,
installation costs, personnel training, and maintenance must be compared with the expected benefits,
such as reducing costs, increasing productivity, and quality. Technological compatibility with existing
infrastructure and software ensures smooth operation and minimizes risks. Training and adaptation of
personnel is a prerequisite. Personnel must be trained in the effective use of equipment and understand
its benefits. Monitoring and evaluation of results make it possible to determine the effectiveness of
implementation, identify problems and make adjustments. Compliance with these principles ensures
the successful implementation of innovative equipment, increasing competitiveness and improving the
quality of services in the restaurant business.

metadata.title: The Role of Battery Recycling in the Electric Vehicle Lifecycle
metadata.description: The global shift towards electric vehicles (EVs) is an important step in addressing climate change and reducing carbon emissions from the transportation sector. While EVs are often seen as an environmentally friendly alternative to internal combustion engine vehicles, the impact of their battery production, usage, and disposal must also be considered in their full lifecycle. This paper explores the role of battery recycling in the lifecycle of EVs, focusing on its environmental, economic, and technological implications. It also addresses the current state of battery recycling practices, challenges, and innovations in the field. By promoting more sustainable recycling solutions, the EV industry can reduce its overall environmental footprint and create a more sustainable and circular economy.
keywords: Electric Vehicles (EVs),Battery Recycling, Lithium-ion Batteries, EV Lifecycle, Sustainable Transportation, Battery Second Life, Circular Economy, Resource Recovery, End-of-Life Management, Recycling Technologies, Environmental Impact, Battery Materials (Lithium, Cobalt, Nickel),Energy Storage, E-waste Management
references: 1.	Goodenough, J. B., & Park, K. S. (2013). The Li-ion rechargeable battery: A perspective. Journal of the American Chemical Society, 135(4), 1167-1176.
2.	Li, X., & Yang, Y. (2021). Battery recycling in the electric vehicle era: Challenges and opportunities. Journal of Cleaner Production, 293, 125751.
3.	Zhang, L., & Duan, H. (2020). Lithium-ion battery recycling: A review. Journal of Power Sources, 452, 227766.

journal.title: Recent Trends in Control and Converter

data.title: The Role of Battery Recycling in the Electric Vehicle Lifecycle

metadata.title: AURORA.jl
metadata.description:
See CHANGELOG.md for a description of the changes.

What's Changed

  • Optimize secondary electrons calculations by @egavazzi in https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/pull/44
  • Better citation by @egavazzi in https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/pull/46
  • Rewrite analysis functions in Julia by @egavazzi in https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/pull/42
  • Fix problem with web documentation build failing by @egavazzi in https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/pull/48
  • remove matlab dependencies by @egavazzi in https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/pull/49
  • Add animation in Julia by @egavazzi in https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/pull/50
  • Precompile cross sections by @egavazzi in https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/pull/51
  • Precompile the scattering functions by @egavazzi in https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/pull/52
  • Save results anywhere by @egavazzi in https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/pull/57
  • Clean dependencies + use extension for Makie by @egavazzi in https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/pull/56
  • Add possibility to choose the bottom altitude of the simulations by @ostald in https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/pull/58
  • Clean stuff by @egavazzi in https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/pull/59
  • Fix altitude lims by @egavazzi in https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/pull/61
  • Faster phase functions calculations by @egavazzi in https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/pull/62
  • Prepare v0.5.0 by @egavazzi in https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/pull/63

New Contributors

  • @ostald made their first contribution in https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/pull/58

Full Changelog: https://github.com/egavazzi/AURORA.jl/compare/v0.4.3...v0.5.0
